name: Hillside Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hillside for a weekend to celebrate a friend's birthday. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel very welcome & at home. Anna & Gert have obviously put a lot of hard work, thought & love into refurbishing the place & IT SHOWS. The rooms are lovely & clean & the beds are extremely comfortable. Dinner in the hotel was delicious & a real effort had been made to accommodate my special diet without making me feel like I was making a fuss. The seaview from our bedroom window was stunning - looking out over a wonderful terrace. My advice can only be "GO THERE - WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR!"
reviews.title: Outstanding in every way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived at the Hillside to the moment we left, we were made to feel most welcome by Anna and Gert and were treated like good friends. The pictures on their website look fantastic but you really have to visit this place to fully appreciate all it has to offer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I had a lovely relaxing time. The drinks overlooking the sea, three course dinner and breakfast the following day were superb. A lovely old building beautifully renovated very stylishly and with great attention to detail. Service is spot on. Its hard to believe the owners have only been up and running for a year. Will definitely be going back again.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great building, with all white and pale wood furnishings with modern art providing the colour. However, it is alongside the main road out of Ventnor and was noisy with the bedroom windows open to cope with the heat. We booked and had confirmed a room with a bathroom, but got a shower room and the owner denied any knowledge of our 'with bath' booking. It did not start off well being told that we were not allowed to have food or drinks in the room, that the main door would be locked and the building alarmed at 10pm and you would have to wake the owners up if you came in after that. We know that we should all save energy, but to be told that we should turn the shower room light off as soon as we came out added to the makings of an impending youth hostel experience. We were told that drinks would be served from 6pm (we arrived at 6.40pm and the owner checked her watch to see if we should still be served drinks) and that dinner was at 7pm, a couple who arrived at 7.10pm had their starters put in front of them as they sat down. For the first night you selected your main course before arriving, fish, meat or vegetarian, however it turned out there was no choice of starters or deserts, which was a problem as both were dairy based. We declined to dine in on the second night and ate at the excellent Michelin starred Hamborough, although their three hour tasting menu meant we did not get back to Hillside until after midnight, which did not go down well with mein host when he had to be woken up to let us in. I went down at 8.30am to say we would not require breakfast to be told "we will clear your table then". It gets worse we went out that day and were pursued across the island via telephone messages to our mobile and via our children at home!! (who were obviously worried, thinking we may have had an accident) to contact the owner urgently. Upon returning the call we were told to leave the guesthouse because my wife had inadvertently got make up on the pillow whilst sleeping!!! and they could not have this happening!!
reviews.title: Bizarre weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We returned to find the door locked (4.00pm!) packed and paid and suggested the owners should move into another business as they were obviously not cut out for the hospitality industry. We thought it was incumbent on a 'hotelier' to make his guests feel welcome not to treat them as interlopers into their house and common criminals, who's only crime was to temporarily mark their linen.
reviews.title: just like home but with bells & whistles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good news is we found, at short notice, fantastic 4 star accomodation and upon telling the owner of our experience he offered to inform the I.O.W. Tourist board calling the Hillside owners amateurs that would give the Island a bad name which at a time of recession was not helpful. He said " Madam it is not up to our paying guests to keep the linen clean, but up to us to supply linen for your use" We have stayed at some fabulous guest houses and hotels and have always given them good ratings but obviously we did not conform to Hillsides dictatorial regime, we did not eat in every night, we did not purchase the heavily pushed champagne "at no cost" i.e. £38 and we rested our weary heads on the pillows.
reviews.title: A wonderful place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a surprise to walk in the front door of this beautiful old stone hotel! The stunning contemporary renovation with a Danish touch, sleek clean rooms along with bright splashes of artwork, made for a refreshing stay. An even bigger surprise was the dining experience. Perfect 3 course meals made with the freshest ingredients by the in-house chef. Perfect! Delightful hosts, great wine list and a wonderful view. One of our best hotel stays. Ten out of ten!!
reviews.title: One of a kind

aka: Hillside Hotel Ventnor, Isle Of Wight
description: Award winning Hillside is a charming 18th-century Grade II listed Hotel built of mellow stone and thatch, with panoramic sea views and a southerly aspect. Set within 5 acres, backed by St. Boniface Down overlooking the Victorian town of Ventnor, Hillside's location is delightful in summer, sheltered and cosy in winter. Hillside has 2 eateries: Hillside Restaurant and Hillside Bistro giving super choices for lunch and evening meals of highest standard. Hillside is welcoming individuals and groups. Hillside Hotel is a calm place to relax and enjoy great company and presence. Welcome.
